ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] A question or two
ygData.msgSnippet: Salutations! Thanks for the note. Is there a way to unbind your soul so that it s no longer bound to any specific location. ... Brangvyne ...
ygData.messageBody:
Salutations!

Thanks for the note.

Is there a way to unbind your soul so that it's no
longer bound to any specific location.

:o)
Brangvyne

--- Christina Norman <tina@...>
wrote:
>
> It is probably best to join an existing guild, an
> existing guild will have
> more experienced players who can help you learn the
> game. Running a guild
> is a lot of work!
>
> Retrieving bodies when you are level 10 or higher
> can be difficult. If you
> think you're going to die it's a good idea to
> quickly type
>
> /l
>
> this will tell you your current location. When you
> die, write down the
> number, then you can use /l to see how close you are
> to that location
> while you're trying to find your body.
>
> Bards, Necromancers, and Shadow Knights can locate
> corpses with spells. If
> there is one in the zone they will often help you if
> you are polite.
>
> - Christina
>
> On Mon, 11 Nov 2002, Brangvyne wrote:
>
> > Salutations!
> >
> > Can anyone give me information about starting a
> guild, is that
> > possible, or do you have to join an existing one?
> >
> > Can anyone give me some sewing tips? I've figured
> out how to take a
> > ruined wolf pelt and certain patterns and put them
> in the small
> > sewing kit to make tunics, boots, etc. but what
> about other things. I
> > have not gotten anything to work in my large
> sewing kit at all yet,
> > keeps saying it's the wrong stuff. The
> instructions for sewing large
> > items say use a ruined bear pelt and an
> appropriate pattern which
> > patterns would those be?
> >
> > Finally, for now I was with someone who died the
> other day and we
> > were haveing a lot of trouble finding her body so
> she could get her
> > stuff back. After a while she said that someone
> else had gotten the
> > stuff for her. How does this work? If I die and
> can't find my body
> > how do I get my stuff back? How can I do this for
> someone else?
> >
> > Thanks for any help ya'll can give,
> >
> > :o)
> > Brangvyne
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to
> http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
> >
> >
>
>
